Properties.description:
These are the key to reading values from the slider and defining its properties.
Every property's value is accessed using code//<sliderInstance>.<property>

Configuration properties.description: Define the slider's configuration as properties of an object passed as a parameter into a#functions//various functions//.

min.description: The minimum value of the slider's range

max.description: The maximum value of the slider's range

value.description: Used to specify the value the slider and its knob should start at

comma.description: How many digits the value should have after its decimal place

width.description:
The final width of the slider.
A number represents the width in pixels regardless of the slider's range, whereas the keyword 'auto' computes the width automatically from the slider's range in a 1:1 ratio.
If the property code//+a#//absWidth is false, which is default, the width is implicit; it is expanded by a small amount resembling the padding at the sides of the slider (The default padding is half of the slider knob's width either side) in order to get an expected result
